meanings.definition: To establish or organize an institution again.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to reinstate the old hospital and reinstitutionalize it for better healthcare services.
meanings.sent2: After the fire destroyed the school, they had to reinstate classes and reinstitutionalize the education system.
meanings.sent3: The town council's plan to reinstitutionalize the abandoned library was met with cheers from the community.
meanings.sent4: The artist wanted to reinstitutionalize the art gallery to showcase local talent and creativity.
meanings.sent5: The decision to reinstitutionalize the historic building brought new life and purpose to the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To return someone to an institution for care or treatment.
meanings.sent1: The doctor had to reinstitutionalize the patient for further medical attention and monitoring.
meanings.sent2: Due to his worsening condition, they had to reinstitutionalize him in the psychiatric facility.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat kept escaping, so they had to reinstitutionalize it in the pet shelter.
meanings.sent4: The rehabilitation center had to reinstitutionalize the recovering addict to ensure a successful recovery.
meanings.sent5: The family had to make the difficult decision to reinstitutionalize their elderly relative for specialized care and support.
